description: The underlying technical cause of CVE-2023-36026 is a spoofing vulnerability found in Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based), specifically in build 119.0.2151.72. This vulnerability allows an attacker to bypass warnings associated with permission messages when accessing potentially malicious websites. The attack is facilitated through user interaction, as the user must click on a specially crafted URL, which could lead to unexpected modifications of data without the user being aware. The vulnerability is bound to the network stack, making it remotely exploitable from the internet. It affects resources managed by the same security authority, and all relevant information can be found under KB-119.0.2151.72.
